Description: Fragment from body of North Ionian black-figured pottery vessel, probably krater or dinos. Inside reserved; outside, the head and front of body of a lion to left, in red and black, and rosettes, all with incised detail.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 224, no. 103)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 109, pl. XXXIV, no. 320.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1158)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4807 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
